column4: hello im trying to make a dualboot and the question is should the linux partition have "bootable flag"?
im using https://wiki.ubuntu.com/WindowsDualBootHowTo
Nope.  Neither of the 2 linux partitions that i boot from are flagged bootable :)
anything else i should think of? (n00b when it comes to my laptop inspiron 9400)
i hade to use vga=771 when i booted thats all i think so far.. :P
not that i can think of
thank you very much
bbl
yw :)
hehe one more thing.... primary or logical for the swap partition?
doesn't matter (but mine is logical)
okey thank you again
when im already here... how big should a swap partition be if i got 1024mb ddr2 533
anyone? swap how big when 1024mb ddr2
I reckon 1GB - rule of thumb is 2xRAM up to a maximum of 1GB
will the swap make a big difference?
some even say max out at 512MB
btw it's not a 'final' decision - you can create a file on the filesystem to use as swap anyway
gee you'd think there'd be a factoid for launchpad
!launchpad is a collection of services for projects in the open source universe - https://launchpad.net/
install complete.. how do i "su -"
sudo -i
